author: Annie Dang
title: Thrillseekers ride The Royal Flush
text:
Thrillseekers ride The Royal Flush ANNIE DANG Last updated 15:36, July 1 2015 YouTube/ROUND III MEDIA 
An epic summer adventure: The slide sends riders flying into the air. 
A video of a giant Texan waterslide proves that this adrenalin-pumping, thrill-seeking ride is not one for faint-hearted. 
The Royal Flush in the BSR Cable Park sends riders soaring into the air – an experience some have described as like flying, while others have called it a watery nightmare – into a 4.9-metre pool. 
&amp;nbsp; 
The video was posted on YouTube two weeks ago by ROUND III Media and has been viewed by more than 12 million people and received more than 28,000 likes. 
It features young biking-clad females and fit-looking males speeding down three giant slides, putting on acrobatic displays as they fly through the air from ramps and splash into a gigantic clay-bottom pool below. 
The Royal Flush in the BSR Cable Park. Photo: YouTube/ROUND III MEDIA 
Acrobatics, selfie-sticks and even back-flips on bicycles are on display in this slow-motion, highly-stylised video that features a lot of high-fives and even a cute puppy. 
BSR Cable Park is located in Waco, Texas. Construction of The Royal Flush water slide was completed in April. 
An all day Royal Flush pass costs $US15 (NZ$22) and riders must be at least six years old. See www.bsrcablepark.com/royal-flush-slide .
